chapter.title: 漂亮小女校：Lojban selbri的结构

section.title: Lojban实词：brivla
section.para: bridi与selbri的关系 selbri与bridi的关系 selbri定义 bridi定义 处在每个Lojban bridi的中心的，逻辑上地，而且常常是物理上地，是一个或多个组成selbri的词。bridi表达了事物间的关系：selbri确定了提到的关系。

interlinear-gloss.jbo: do mamta mi
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 你 是x的母亲 我
interlinear-gloss.natlang: 你是我的母亲

section.para: 和

interlinear-gloss.jbo: do patfu mi
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 你 是x的父亲 我。
interlinear-gloss.natlang: 你是我的父亲。

section.para: 之间的差别在于selbri的不同。
brivla类型 作为selbri的brivla selbri由brivla充当 最简单的selbri是单个Lojban实词：一个brivla。brivla有三种：语言内建的（gismu）、从gismu的组合中衍生出的（lujvo）和从别的语言中（通常以修改过的形式）拿来的（fu'ivla）。另外，有一些cmavo表现得像brivla一样；它们在 中有提到，在 中完整讨论。
为了本章的目的，不过，所有的brivla都被视作相似的。例如，

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta bloti
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 那 是船。
interlinear-gloss.natlang: 那是船。

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta brablo
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 那 是大船。
interlinear-gloss.natlang: 那是舰艇。

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta blotrskunri
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 那 是纵帆船。
interlinear-gloss.natlang: 那是纵帆船。

section.para: 说明了三种brivla（分别是gismu、lujvo和fu'ivla），但每个例子中selbri都是由单个可以不依赖来源地学习的词组成的。
本章剩余部分将主要以gismu作为示例的brivla，因为它们很短。但重要的是，要在心里记住任何gismu出现的地方都可以换成其余种类的brivla。

section.title: 简单的tanru
section.para: tanru定义 tanru简单 除单个brivla外，selbri还可以由两个放在一起的brivla组成。selbri像这样由不止一个brivla组成时就叫tanru，这个词没有单个英语对应词。英语中和tanru最接近的是两个名词的组合，像 柠檬树。不能只看词组 柠檬树就知道其意思，即使知道 柠檬和 树各自的意思。作为英语者，我们确实简单地就知道它指 以柠檬为果实的树。不很懂英语的人可能认为它和 棕色的树相似，并疑惑 哪种树是柠檬色的？
形容词-名词组合和tanru 副词-动词组合和tanru 在Lojban中，tanru也被用于与英文的形容词-名词组合如 大男孩以及副词-动词组合如 快跑相同的目的。这是Lojban没有像 名词、 动词、 形容词或 副词之类的分类的结果。这类英文在Lojban中译为简单的brivla。这是一些tanru的例子：

interlinear-gloss.jbo: tu pelnimre tricu
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 远处的那个 是柠檬 树。
interlinear-gloss.natlang: 那是柠檬树。

interlinear-gloss.jbo: la djan. barda nanla
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 名为 John 是大 男孩。
interlinear-gloss.natlang: John是大男孩。

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi sutra bajra
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 我 快 跑
interlinear-gloss.natlang: 我跑得快。

section.para: 注意 pelnimre是 柠檬的lujvo；它从gismu pelxu（黄色）和 nimre（柑橘）派生而来。也要注意 sutra可以意味着 快或 快（副词），取决于其用法：

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi sutra
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 我 快

section.para: 展示了 sutra用于翻译形容词的情形，然而在 中它被翻译为副词（在中文版中仍为形容词）。（另一个 的正确翻译，然而，是 我是个很快的跑者。）
tertau定义 seltau定义 tanru的两部分有特别的从 tanru的位结构中派生出的Lojban术语。第一部分称 seltau，第二部分称 tertau。
tertau对tanru意思的影响 tanru主要意思 解释tanru最重要的规则是tertau承担主要意思。 pelnimre tricu首先是一棵树，然后才与柠檬以某种方式联系起来。因此， 的代替翻译可以是：
这个tanru的组分间的 型的关系对tanru的概念是首要的。
修饰词由seltau充当 seltau对tanru意思的影响 我们可能还会说seltau修饰了tertau的含义：

example.para: 那是（以对树合适的方式）柠檬化的树

section.para: 将会是 的另一个可能翻译。同样地， 更显式的翻译可能是：

example.para: John是以男孩大的方式大的男孩。

section.para: 这个 男孩大的方式将会和大象大的方式非常不同；对男孩而言的大是对大象而言的小。
tanru的歧义 tanru歧义 所有tanru在语义上都是模糊的。

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta klama jubme
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 那 是移动者 型的桌子。

section.para: 的可能翻译包括：

listitem.para: 那是个可以移动的桌子（可能是带椅子的桌子）。
那是某个移动者拥有的桌子。
那是由移动者们使用的桌子（体育医生的桌子？）。
那个在走的时候是桌子（否则就是椅子？）。

section.para: tanru模糊 例子中被指代的对象都是 移动者型的桌子，但模糊的 型关系可能有很多意思。使用tanru的说话人（实际上所有说话人都必须）承担误解的风险。使用tanru很方便，因为它们很短又有表现力；挤掉所有歧义的赘言可能要求太多努力。
tanru意思 没有覆盖所有可能tanru含义的泛用理论；可能这样的理论不可能存在。不过，确实存在一些明显的规律：

interlinear-gloss.jbo: do barda prenu
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 你 是大 人物。

interlinear-gloss.jbo: do cmalu prenu
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 你 是小 人物。

section.para: 在 barda与 prenu间的关系和 cmalu与 prenu间的关系相同的意义上是平行的tanru。 和 包含一些种类的tanru的部分列表和示例。

section.title: 由bo组织起来的三个部分组成的tanru
section.para: 本节将讨论下面这些cmavo：
tanru结合三部分 考虑如下英语句子：
它是什么意思？两种可能的读法是：
言语韵律英文中的结合 这种歧义与 中描述的简单tanru的歧义很不同。我们明白 女校指 女孩做学生的学校而非 女孩做老师的学校或 同时是一个女孩的学校（！）。类似地，我们明白 小女意味着 小女孩。这是结合的歧义。是把 女校当作单元，其中 小确定女校的类型？还是把 小女当作单元，确定学校的类型？在英文口语中，不同的语调或 夸张的言语韵律表明结合，用以区别；书面英文通常不这样写。
Lojban不为任何目的使用语调；用显式的词来做这件事。cmavo bo（属于selma'o BO）可以放在两个最紧密地相连的brivla之间。因此， 的一个Lojban翻译会是：

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta cmalu nixli bo ckule
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 那 是小的 女孩 [-] 学校。

section.para: 可能译作：

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta cmalu bo nixli ckule
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 那 是小 [-] 女孩 的学校。

section.para: bo在字面翻译中用括号括起来的连字符表示（不要和其余注解中的裸连字符混淆），因为在书面英语中连字符有时用于相同目的： a big dog-catcher和 big-dog catcher（想必有人只抓大狗）很不同。

嵌套于tanru中的tanru 对 和 的分析显露出嵌套在tanru中的tanru。在 中，主tanru的seltau是 cmalu，tertau是 nixli bo ckule；tertau自己就是tanru，其中 nixli是seltau， ckule是tertau。在 中，然而，seltau是 cmalu bo nixli（它自己就是tanru），而tertau是 ckule。 这种tanru套tanru的结构构成了所有下面解释的更复杂类型的基础。
那 如何呢？它是什么意思？

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta cmalu nixli ckule
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 那 是小的 女孩的 学校。

section.para: tanru默认左结合 左结合规则定义 不像英语的规则对 的处理，Lojban的规则明确了这句话的意思。语言设计者们的决定是让 和 意思相同。无论使用哪三个brivla这都对：最左边的两个总是结合在一起。这个规则叫 左结合规则。左结合在看起来模糊的结构上相当普遍——尽管不普适——在其他Lojban的语境中。
表达 和 的英文含义的另一种方式，用括号来标记结合，是：

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta cmalu - nixli bo ckule
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 那 是小 型的 （女孩 型的 学校）。

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta cmalu bo nixli - ckule
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 那 是（小 型的 女孩） 型的 学校。

section.para: 因为 型在Lojban的tanru形式中是隐式的，它没有Lojban等价。
注意：在简单的tanru中插入 bo是完全合法的，尽管无意义：

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta klama bo jubme
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 那 是移动者 [-] 桌子。

section.para: 是与 意思完全一样的合法的Lojban bridi，而且和它模糊得完全一样。cmavo bo只用于解决结合歧义：它对所有tanru中都有的更基本的歧义毫无作用。

section.title: 复杂的tanru结合
section.para: tanru结合复杂的 如果tanru的一个元素可以是另一个tanru，为什么不能两个元素都是？

interlinear-gloss.jbo: do mutce bo barda gerku bo kavbu
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 你 是（非常 型的 大） （狗 型的 捕捉者）。
interlinear-gloss.natlang: 你是体型很大的捉狗者。

section.para: 在 中，selbri是以 mutce bo barda为seltau、以 gerku bo kavbu为tertau的tanru。值得再次强调的是，这个tanru和其余Lojban中的tanru有相同的基本歧义： 狗 型的 捕捉者被称为 非常 型的 大的方式不精确。可以假定他的体型很大，但理论上也可以是他的其余特性很大。

pretty英文的歧义 我们现在通过探索词组 漂亮小女校，
中使用的tanru的一种四brivla拓展的结果来为本章标题寻找一个合理的解释。（尽管该例从Loglan开始时就已被使用——首次出现于Quine的书 Word and Object（1960）——它实际上是很平庸的例子，由于英文 pretty的歧义；它可以指 漂亮（即此处义），也可以指 非常。Lojban的 melbi不受该歧义的影响：它的意思只有 漂亮。）
这有四种该词组的结合方式：

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta melbi - cmalu - nixli - ckule
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 那 是（（漂亮 型的 小） 型的 女孩） 型的 学校。
interlinear-gloss.natlang: 那是漂亮地小的女孩上的学校。

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta melbi - cmalu nixli bo ckule
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 那 是（漂亮 型的 小） （女孩 型的 学校）。
interlinear-gloss.natlang: 那是个漂亮地小的女校。

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta melbi - cmalu bo nixli - ckule
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 那 是（漂亮 型的 （小 型的 女孩）） 型的 学校。
interlinear-gloss.natlang: 那是漂亮的小女孩上的学校。

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta melbi - cmalu bo nixli bo ckule
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 那 是漂亮 型的 （小 型的 （女孩 型的 学校））。
interlinear-gloss.natlang: 那是漂亮的小女校。

section.para:
botanru中的右结合 tanru结合用bo tanru中的右结合用bo 右结合规则定义 用了没见过的构造： cmalu bo nixli bo ckule，在brivla间用了两个连续的 bo。多个 bo的构造规则和没有 bo时表现出的规则相反：最后两个结合在一起。不出所料，这称作 右结合规则，而且和语言中
bo的每个使用联系在一起。因此，

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta cmalu bo nixli bo ckule
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 那 是小 型的 （女孩 型的 学校）。

section.para: 和 意思相同，而与 意思不同。这规则乍看起来很奇特，但其结果之一是在已呈现的所有复杂tanru的前两个元素间无需 bo：从 到 都可以在 melbi和 cmalu之间插入 bo而不改变意思。

section.title: 使用ke和ke'e的复杂tanru
section.para: 本节要讨论以下cmavo：

tanru结合用ke 结合的括号 实际上 漂亮小女校还有不能用现在这些东西解释的第五种结合。为了处理这种结合，我们必须引进括号cmavo
ke和 ke'e（分别属于selma'o KE和KEhE）。selbri中这两个cmavo间夹着的任何部分被当作tanru的单个组分，与相邻的部分无关。这样， 可以如下重写：

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta ke melbi cmalu ke'e nixli ckule
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 那 是（ 漂亮 小 ） 女孩 学校。

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta ke ke melbi cmalu ke'e nixli ke'e ckule
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 那 是（ （ 漂亮 小 ） 女孩 ） 学校。

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta ke ke ke melbi cmalu ke'e nixli ke'e ckule ke'e
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 那 是（ （ （ 漂亮 小 ） 女孩 ） 学校 ）。

section.para: 只要简单地在selbri的开头放任意数目的 kecmavo、在结尾放差不多数目的 ke'ecmavo就可以创造出更多版本。显然，掌握左结合规则后所有这些都是浪费口舌。不过，下面这个例子和 等价，而且可能更容易理解：

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta - melbi - ke cmalu - nixli ke'e - - ckule
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 那 是（ 漂亮 型的 （ 小 型的 女孩 ） ） 型的 学校。

section.para: 类似地， 的 ke和 ke'e版本会是：

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta melbi - cmalu ke nixli - ckule [ke'e]
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 那 是（漂亮 型的 小） （ 女孩 型的 学校 ）。

section.para:
最后的 ke'e在方括号中给出，表明它可以省略。在selbri的结尾省略
ke'e总是可能的，这使得 可以和 一样紧凑。
那那个第五种结合是什么呢？它是

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta melbi - ke - cmalu - nixli - - ckule [ke'e]
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 那 是漂亮 型的 （ （ 小 型的 女孩 ） 型的 学校 ）。
interlinear-gloss.natlang: 那是小女孩上的漂亮学校。

section.para: 和到的意思截然不同。注意在 ke……ke'e的括号内， cmalu nixli ckule应用左结合规则。

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta melbi - ke cmalu
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 那 是漂亮 型的 （ 小

section.para: ，也可以等价地表述为

interlinear-gloss.gloss: 那 是漂亮 型的 （ 小 型的（ 女孩 型的 学校 ））。

section.title: tanru内的逻辑联系
section.para: 本节要讨论以下cmavo：
考虑英语短语 大红狗。该如何将其翻译为Lojban的tanru？天真的尝试：

interlinear-gloss.jbo: barda - xunre - gerku
interlinear-gloss.gloss: （大 型的 红） 型的 狗

section.para: 不行，它指（以任何红色可能被描述为 大的方式）红色很大的狗。

interlinear-gloss.jbo: barda - xunre bo gerku
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 大 型的 （红 型的 狗）

section.para:
形容词次序也没好到哪去。毕竟，这个英语短语的直接理解是这个狗比其他狗大而不仅比其他红狗大。实际上，大和红是狗的两个独立属性，只是英语形容词次序的模糊规则阻止我们说
红大狗。
逻辑连词tanru中的 Lojban解决该问题的方法是引进cmavo je（英文 and的众多等价物之一）。大红狗既大又红，我们可以说：

interlinear-gloss.jbo: barda je xunre - gerku
interlinear-gloss.gloss: （大 和 红） 型的 狗

section.para: 当然，

interlinear-gloss.jbo: xunre je barda - gerku
interlinear-gloss.gloss: （红 和 大） 型的 狗

section.para: tanru中的逻辑连词对tanru结合的影响一样令人满意，而且指同样的东西。正如这些例子表明的，用 je连接起brivla产生tanru的单元。不过，用 bo或 ke……ke'e的显式结合比 je产生的结合更紧密：

interlinear-gloss.jbo: barda je pelxu bo xunre gerku
interlinear-gloss.gloss: （大 和 （黄 型的 红）） 狗

interlinear-gloss.jbo: barda je ke pelxu - xunre ke'e gerku
interlinear-gloss.gloss: （大 和 （ 黄 型的 红 ）） 狗
interlinear-gloss.natlang: 大的黄红色的狗

section.para: 没有结合指示词时，我们得到：

interlinear-gloss.jbo: barda je pelxu - xunre - gerku
interlinear-gloss.gloss: （（大 和 黄） 型的 红） 型的 狗
interlinear-gloss.natlang: 又大又黄地红的狗

section.para: 。这又引出了 的问题： 大红是什么意思？
tanru中的逻辑连词实用性 和 bo与 ke……ke'e不同， je不仅有用，而且在简单tanru中也合法。它可以用来部分解决简单tanru的歧义：

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta blanu je zdani
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 那 是蓝色的 并且 是房子

section.para: 一定指蓝而且是房子的东西，而非简单的 blanu zdani的其余可能解释。而且， blanu zdani指以房子蓝的方式蓝的东西； blanu je zdani没有这样的暗示—— blanu je zdani的蓝和它的房子性相独立。

加上了 je， 漂亮小女校就可能存在更多版本：完整列表参见
。
像 的tanru的语义细微之处需要特别澄清。至少存在两种可能的解释：

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta melbi je nixli - ckule
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 那 是（漂亮 和 女孩） 型的 学校。

section.para: 它可以理解成：

example.para: 那是女校而且是漂亮的学校。

section.para: or as:

example.para: 那是为既是女孩也漂亮的东西开的学校。

section.para: tanru中的逻辑连词歧义 的解释把tanru用作缩略：

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta ke melbi - ckule ke'e je ke nixli - ckule [ke'e]
interlinear-gloss.gloss: 那 是（ 漂亮 型的 学校 ） 和 （ 女孩 型的 学校 ）

section.para: ，不过 的解释不这样用。这种语义模糊Lojban不强制明确的解决方案。学校称为 漂亮和女孩型的方式可能暗示它分别是漂亮的学校和女校；但其余的解释，像学校的成员漂亮而且是女孩，也有可能。还有一种解释是：

example.para: 这是为漂亮的东西和女孩服务的学校。

section.para: 所以尽管逻辑连词帮助解释tanru的意义，它们并不强制自己含义唯一。
tanru中的逻辑连词对形式逻辑转换的影响 一般而言，tanru中的逻辑连词不能进行tanru外的相关逻辑连词可以进行的形式转换；更多细节参见 。

section.title: Linked sumti: be-bei-be'o
section.para: The following cmavo are discussed in this section:

The question of the place structures of selbri has been glossed over so far. This chapter does not attempt to treat place structure issues in detail; they are discussed in . One grammatical structure related to places belongs here, however. In simple sentences such as , the place structure of the selbri is simply the defined place structure of the gismu mamta. What about more complex selbri?

tanruplace structures of For tanru, the place structure rule is simple: the place structure of a tanru is always the place structure of its tertau. Thus, the place structure of blanu zdani is that of zdani: the x1 place is a house or nest, and the x2 place is its occupants.

What about the places of blanu? Is there any way to get them into the act? In fact, blanu has only one place, and this is merged, as it were, with the x1 place of zdani. It is whatever is in the x1 place that is being characterized as blue-for-a-house. But if we replace blanu with xamgu, we get:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ti xamgu zdani
interlinear-gloss.gloss: This is-a-good house.
interlinear-gloss.natlang: This is a good (for someone, by some standard) house.

section.para: Since xamgu has three places (x1, the good thing; x2, the person for whom it is good; and x3, the standard of goodness), necessarily omits information about the last two: there is no room for them. Room can be made, however!

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ti xamgu be do bei mi [be'o] zdani
interlinear-gloss.gloss: This is-a-good (for you by-standard me) - house.
interlinear-gloss.natlang: This is a house that is good for you by my standards.

section.para: linked sumtiin tanru seltaufilling sumti places in Here, the gismu xamgu has been followed by the cmavo be (of selma'o BE), which signals that one or more sumti follows. These sumti are not part of the overall bridi place structure, but fill the places of the brivla they are attached to, starting with x2. If there is more than one sumti, they are separated by the cmavo bei (of selma'o BEI), and the list of sumti is terminated by the elidable terminator be'o (of selma'o BEhO).

linked sumtidefinition Grammatically, a brivla with sumti linked to it in this fashion plays the same role in tanru as a simple brivla. To illustrate, here is a fully fleshed-out version of , with all places filled in:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ti cmalu be le ka canlu
interlinear-gloss.gloss: This is-a-small (in-dimension the property-of volume

interlinear-gloss.jbo: … bei lo'e ckule be'o
interlinear-gloss.gloss: … by-standard the-typical school) -

interlinear-gloss.jbo: … nixli be li mu
interlinear-gloss.gloss: … (girl (of-years the-number five

interlinear-gloss.jbo: … bei lo merko be'o bo ckule
interlinear-gloss.gloss: … by-standard some American-thing) - - school)

interlinear-gloss.jbo: … la bryklyn.
interlinear-gloss.gloss: … in-that-named Brooklyn

interlinear-gloss.jbo: loi pemci
interlinear-gloss.gloss: with-subject poems

interlinear-gloss.jbo: le mela nu,IORK. prenu
interlinear-gloss.gloss: for-audience-the among-that-named New-York persons

interlinear-gloss.jbo: le jecta
interlinear-gloss.gloss: with-operator-the state.
interlinear-gloss.natlang: This is a school, small in volume compared to the typical school, pertaining to five-year-old girls (by American standards), in Brooklyn, teaching poetry to the New York community and operated by the state.

section.para: Here the three places of cmalu, the three of nixli, and the four of ckule are fully specified. Since the places of ckule are the places of the bridi as a whole, it was not necessary to link the sumti which follow ckule. It would have been legal to do so, however:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi klama be le zarci bei le zdani [be'o]
interlinear-gloss.gloss: I go ( to-the market - from-the house ).

section.para: means the same as

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi klama le zarci le zdani
interlinear-gloss.gloss: I go to-the market from-the house.

section.para: tanruplace structures of No matter how complex a tanru gets, the last brivla always dictates the place structure: the place structure of

interlinear-gloss.jbo: - melbi je cmalu nixli bo ckule
interlinear-gloss.gloss: a (pretty and little) (girl - school)
interlinear-gloss.natlang: a school for girls which is both beautiful and small

section.para: is simply that of ckule. (The sole exception to this rule is discussed in .)

FA tags and linked sumti linked sumti and FA tags It is possible to precede linked sumti by the place structure ordering tags
fe, fi, fo, and fu (of selma'o FA, discussed further in ), which serve to explicitly specify the x2, x3, x4, and x5 places respectively. Normally, the place following the be is the x2 place and the other places follow in order. If it seems convenient to change the order, however, it can be accomplished as follows:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ti xamgu be fi mi bei fe do [be'o] zdani
interlinear-gloss.gloss: This is-a-good ( by-standard me - for you ) house.

section.para: which is equivalent in meaning to . Note that the order of be, bei, and be'o does not change; only the inserted fi tells us that mi is the x3 place (and correspondingly, the inserted fe tells us that do is the x2 place). Changing the order of sumti is often done to match the order of another language, or for emphasis or rhythm.
Of course, using FA cmavo makes it easy to specify one place while omitting a previous place:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ti xamgu be fi mi [be'o] zdani
interlinear-gloss.gloss: This is-a-good ( by-standard me ) house.
interlinear-gloss.natlang: This is a good house by my standards.

section.para: sumti tcita and tense tags tense tags and sumti tcita sumti tcita and modal tags modal tags and sumti tcita sumti tcita and linked sumti linked sumti and sumti tcita Similarly, sumti labeled by modal or tense tags can be inserted into strings of linked sumti just as they can into bridi:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta blanu be ga'a mi [be'o] zdani
interlinear-gloss.gloss: That is-a-blue ( to-observer me ) house.
interlinear-gloss.natlang: That is a blue, as I see it, house.

section.para: The meaning of is slightly different from:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta blanu zdani ga'a mi
interlinear-gloss.gloss: That is-a-blue house to-observer me.
interlinear-gloss.natlang: That is a blue house, as I see it.

section.para: See discussions in of modals and in of tenses for more explanations.

be'oeffect of relative clauses on elidability of relative clauseseffect on elidability of be'o be'oelidability of elidability of be'o The terminator be'o is almost always elidable: however, if the selbri belongs to a description, then a relative clause following it will attach to the last linked sumti unless
be'o is used, in which case it will attach to the outer description:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: le xamgu be do noi barda cu zdani
interlinear-gloss.gloss: The good-thing for you (who are-large) - is-a-house.

interlinear-gloss.jbo: le xamgu be do be'o noi barda cu zdani
interlinear-gloss.gloss: The (good-thing for you ) (which is-large) - is-a-house

section.para: (Relative clauses are explained in .)
be'oeffect of ku on elidability of kueffect on elidability of be'o In other cases, however, be'o cannot be elided if ku has also been elided:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: le xamgu be le ctuca [ku] be'o zdani
interlinear-gloss.gloss: the good (for the teacher) - - house

section.para: requires either ku or be'o, and since there is only one occurrence of be, the be'o must match it, whereas it may be confusing which occurrence of le the ku terminates (in fact the second one is correct).

section.title: Inversion of tanru: co
section.para: The following cmavo is discussed in this section:

tanru inversion The standard order of Lojban tanru, whereby the modifier precedes what it modifies, is very natural to English-speakers: we talk of blue houses, not of houses blue. In other languages, however, such matters are differently arranged, and Lojban supports this reverse order (tertau before seltau) by inserting the particle co. and mean exactly the same thing:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta blanu zdani
interlinear-gloss.gloss: That is-a-blue type-of-house.
interlinear-gloss.natlang: That is a blue house.

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta zdani co blanu
interlinear-gloss.gloss: That is-a-house of-type blue.
interlinear-gloss.natlang: That is a blue house.

section.para: place structure and tanru inversion tanru inversion and place structure The meaning, and more specifically, the place structure, of a tanru is not affected by inversion: the place structure of zdani co blanu is still that of zdani. However, the existence of inversion in a selbri has a very special effect on any sumti which follow that selbri. Instead of being interpreted as filling places of the selbri, they actually fill the places (starting with x2) of the seltau. In , we saw how to fill interior places with be…bei…be'o, and in fact and have the same meaning:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi klama be le zarci bei le zdani be'o troci
interlinear-gloss.gloss: I am-a-(goer to the market from the house ) type-of-trier.
interlinear-gloss.natlang: I try to go to the market from the house.

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi troci co klama le zarci le zdani
interlinear-gloss.gloss: I am-a-trier of-type (goer to-the market from-the house).
interlinear-gloss.natlang: I try to go to the market from the house.

section.para: is a less deeply nested construction, requiring fewer cmavo. As a result it is probably easier to understand.

Note that in Lojban trying to go is expressed using troci as the tertau. The reason is that trying to go is a going type of trying, not a trying type of going. The trying is more fundamental than the going – if the trying fails, we may not have a going at all.

inverted tanrueffect on sumti after the selbri inverted tanrueffect on sumti before the selbri unfilled places of inverted tanru Any sumti which precede a selbri with an inverted tanru fill the places of the selbri (i.e., the places of the tertau) in the ordinary way. In
, mi fills the x1 place of troci co klama, which is the x1 place of troci. The other places of the selbri remain unfilled. The trailing sumti le zarci and le zdani do not occupy selbri places, despite appearances.

As a result, the regular mechanisms (involving the vo'a and the go'a-series, explained in and ) for referring to individual sumti of a bridi cannot refer to any of the trailing places of , because they are not really sumti of the bridi at all.

tanru inversionwhere allowed tanru inversionin complex tanru When inverting a more complex tanru, it is possible to invert it only at the most general modifier-modified pair. The only possible inversion of , for instance, is:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta nixli [bo] ckule co cmalu
interlinear-gloss.gloss: That (is-a-girl type-of school) of-type little.
interlinear-gloss.natlang: That's a girls' school which is small.

section.para: tanru groupingeffect of tanru inversion on tanru inversioneffect on tanru grouping Note that the bo of is optional in , because co groups more loosely than any other cmavo used in tanru, including none at all. Not even ke…ke'e parentheses can encompass a co:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta cmalu - ke nixli - ckule [ke'e] co melbi
interlinear-gloss.gloss: That is-a-(little type-of ( girl type-of school )) of-type pretty.
interlinear-gloss.natlang: That's a small school for girls which is beautiful.

section.para: tanru inversionrule for removing In , the ke'e is automatically inserted before the co rather than at its usual place at the end of the selbri. As a result, there is a simple and mechanical rule for removing co from any selbri: change A co B to ke B ke'e A. (At the same time, any sumti following the selbri must be transformed into be…bei…be'o form and attached following B.) Therefore,

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ckule co melbi nixli
interlinear-gloss.gloss: school of-type pretty girl
interlinear-gloss.natlang: school for beautiful girls

section.para: means the same as:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ke melbi nixli ke'e ckule
interlinear-gloss.gloss: ( pretty girl ) school

section.para:
multiple tanru inversioneffect on grouping tanru inversionmultiple Multiple co cmavo can appear within a selbri, indicating multiple inversions: a right-grouping rule is employed, as for
bo. The above rule can be applied to interpret such selbri, but all co cmavo must be removed simultaneously:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ckule co nixli co cmalu
interlinear-gloss.gloss: school of-type (girl of-type little)

section.para: becomes formally

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ke ke cmalu ke'e nixli ke'e ckule
interlinear-gloss.gloss: ( ( little ) girl ) school

section.para: which by the left-grouping rule is simply

interlinear-gloss.jbo: cmalu nixli ckule
interlinear-gloss.gloss: little girl school
interlinear-gloss.natlang: school for little girls

section.para: As stated above, the selbri places, other than the first, of

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi klama co sutra
interlinear-gloss.gloss: I am-a-goer of-type quick
interlinear-gloss.natlang: I go quickly

section.para: cannot be filled by placing sumti after the selbri, because any sumti in that position fill the places of sutra, the seltau. However, the tertau places (which means in effect the selbri places) can be filled with be:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi klama be le zarci be'o co sutra
interlinear-gloss.gloss: I am-a-goer ( to-the store ) of-type quick.
interlinear-gloss.natlang: I go to the store quickly.

section.title: Other kinds of simple selbri
section.para: The following cmavo are discussed in this section:

equivalents to brivla brivla equivalents So far we have only discussed brivla and tanru built up from brivla as possible selbri. In fact, there are a few other constructions in Lojban which are grammatically equivalent to brivla: they can be used either directly as selbri, or as components in tanru. Some of these types of simple selbri are discussed at length in , , and ; but for completeness these types are mentioned here with a brief explanation and an example of their use in selbri.

tanruwith GOhA selbriwith GOhA GOhA selma'oas component in tanru GOhA selma'oas selbri The cmavo of selma'o GOhA (with one exception) serve as pro-bridi, providing a reference to the content of other bridi; none of them has a fixed meaning. The most commonly used member of GOhA is probably go'i, which amounts to a repetition of the previous bridi, or part of it. If I say:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: la djan. klama le zarci
interlinear-gloss.gloss: That-named John goes-to the market.

section.para: you may retort:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: la djan. go'i troci
interlinear-gloss.gloss: That-named John [repeat-last] are-a-trier.
interlinear-gloss.natlang: John tries to.

section.para: is short for:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: la djan. klama be le zarci be'o - troci
interlinear-gloss.gloss: That-named John is-a-goer ( to-the market ) type-of trier.

section.para: because the whole bridi of has been packaged up into the single word go'i and inserted into .
duas an exception within GOhA selma'o The exceptional member of GOhA is du, which represents the relation of identity. Its place structure is:

definition.content: x1 is identical with x2, x3, ...

section.para: for as many places as are given. More information on selma'o GOhA is available in .

tanrucontaining mathematical expressions mathematical expressions in tanru Lojban mathematical expressions (mekso) can be incorporated into selbri in two different ways. Mathematical operators such as
su'i, meaning plus, can be transformed into selbri by prefixing them with nu'a (of selma'o NUhA). The resulting place structure is:

definition.content: x1 is the result of applying (the operator) to arguments x2, x3, etc.

section.para: for as many arguments as are required. (The result goes in the x1 place because the number of following places may be indefinite.) For example:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: li vo nu'a--su'i li re li re
interlinear-gloss.gloss: The-number 4 is-the-sum-of the-number 2 and-the-number 2.

section.para: A possible tanru example might be:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi jimpe tu'a loi nu'a--su'i nabmi
interlinear-gloss.gloss: I understand something-about the-mass-of is-the-sum-of problems.
interlinear-gloss.natlang: I understand addition problems.

section.para:
MOI selma'o More usefully, it is possible to combine a mathematical expression with a cmavo of selma'o MOI to create one of various numerical selbri. Details are available in
. Here are a few tanru:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: la prim. palvr. pamoi cusku
interlinear-gloss.gloss: That-named Preem Palver is-the-1-th speaker.
interlinear-gloss.natlang: Preem Palver is the first speaker.

interlinear-gloss.jbo: la an,iis. joi la .asun.
interlinear-gloss.gloss: That-named Anyi massed-with that-named Asun

interlinear-gloss.jbo: bruna remei
interlinear-gloss.gloss: are-a-brother type-of-twosome.
interlinear-gloss.natlang: Anyi and Asun are two brothers.

section.para: NU selma'o Finally, an important type of simple selbri which is not a brivla is the abstraction. Grammatically, abstractions are simple: a cmavo of selma'o NU, followed by a bridi, followed by the elidable terminator kei of selma'o KEI. Semantically, abstractions are an extremely subtle and powerful feature of Lojban whose full ramifications are documented in . A few examples:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ti nu zdile kei kumfa
interlinear-gloss.gloss: This is-an-event-of amusement - room.
interlinear-gloss.natlang: This is an amusement room.

section.para: abstraction bridicontrasted with component non-abstraction bridi in meaning is quite distinct in meaning from:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ti zdile kumfa
interlinear-gloss.gloss: This is-an-amuser room.

section.para: which suggests the meaning a room that amuses someone.

section.title: selbri based on sumti: me
section.para: The following cmavo are discussed in this section:

meplace structure of conversion of sumti into selbri sumti into selbri selbri from sumti A sumti can be made into a simple selbri by preceding it with me (of selma'o ME) and following it with the elidable terminator me'u (of selma'o MEhU). This makes a selbri with the place structure

definition.content: x1 is one of the referents of [the sumti]

section.para: which is true of the thing, or things, that are the referents of the sumti, and not of anything else. For example, consider the sumti

interlinear-gloss.jbo: le ci nolraitru
interlinear-gloss.gloss: the three noblest-governors
interlinear-gloss.natlang: the three kings

section.para: If these are understood to be the Three Kings of Christian tradition, who arrive every year on January 6, then we may say:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: la BALtazar. cu me le--ci--nolraitru
interlinear-gloss.gloss: That-named Balthazar - is-one-of-the-referents-of the three kings.
interlinear-gloss.natlang: Balthazar is one of the three kings.

section.para: and likewise

interlinear-gloss.jbo: la kaspar. cu me le ci nolraitru
interlinear-gloss.natlang: Caspar is one of the three kings.

section.para: and

interlinear-gloss.jbo: la melxi,or. cu me le ci nolraitru
interlinear-gloss.natlang: Melchior is one of the three kings.

section.para: ducompared with me in effect mecompared with du in effect me/du equivalence If the sumti refers to a single object, then the effect of me is much like that of du:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: do du la djan.
interlinear-gloss.gloss: You are-identical-with that-named John.
interlinear-gloss.natlang: You are John.

section.para: means the same as

interlinear-gloss.jbo: do me la--djan.
interlinear-gloss.gloss: You are-the-referent-of that-named John.
interlinear-gloss.natlang: You are John.

section.para: meused with names It is common to use me selbri, especially those based on name sumti using la, as seltau. For example:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: ta me lai--kraislr. [me'u] karce
interlinear-gloss.gloss: That (is-a-referent-of the-mass-named Chrysler) car.
interlinear-gloss.natlang: That is a Chrysler car.

interlinear-gloss.jbo: re me le ci nolraitru .e la djan. [me'u] cu blabi
interlinear-gloss.natlang: Two of the group the three kings and John are white.

interlinear-gloss.jbo: re me le ci nolraitru me'u .e la djan. cu blabi
interlinear-gloss.natlang: Two of the three kings, and John, are white.

section.para:
In the me selbri covers the three kings plus John, and the indefinite description picks out two of them that are said to be white: we cannot say which two. In
, though, the me selbri covers only the three kings: two of them are said to be white, and so is John.

section.title: Conversion of simple selbri
section.para: xe ve te se SE selma'o place structurere-ordering by conversion conversiondefinition tanru and conversion conversion and tanru Conversion is the process of changing a selbri so that its places appear in a different order. This is not the same as labeling the sumti with the cmavo of FA, as mentioned in , and then rearranging the order in which the sumti are spoken or written. Conversion transforms the selbri into a distinct, though closely related, selbri with renumbered places.
In Lojban, conversion is accomplished by placing a cmavo of selma'o SE before the selbri:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi prami do
interlinear-gloss.natlang: I love you.

interlinear-gloss.jbo: do se prami mi
interlinear-gloss.gloss: You [swap--x1--and--x2] love me.
interlinear-gloss.natlang: You are loved by me.

section.para: Conversion is fully explained in . For the purposes of this chapter, the important point about conversion is that it applies only to the following simple selbri. When trying to convert a tanru, therefore, it is necessary to be careful! Consider :

interlinear-gloss.gloss: That-named Alice - is-a-walker type-of-goer-to the market.
That-named Alice - walkingly goes-to the market.
interlinear-gloss.natlang: Alice walks to the market.

interlinear-gloss.jbo: le zarci cu se
interlinear-gloss.gloss: The market - is-a-[swap--x1/x2]
The market - -

interlinear-gloss.gloss: ( walker type-of-goer-to ) that-named Alice.
- is-walkingly gone-to-by - that-named Alice.

The market - - is-a-walking-surface

type-of-goer-to that-named Alice.

section.para: whatever that might mean. An alternative approach, since the place structure of cadzu klama is that of klama alone, is to convert only the latter:

interlinear-gloss.gloss: The market - walkingly is-gone-to-by that-named Alice.

section.para: But the tanru in may or may not have the same meaning as that in ; in particular, because cadzu is not converted, there is a suggestion that although Alice is the goer, the market is the walker. section.title: Scalar negation of selbri
section.para: selbriscalar negation of scalar negationeffect on selbri Negation is too large and complex a topic to explain fully in this chapter; see . In brief, there are two main types of negation in Lojban. This section is concerned with so-called scalar negation, which is used to state that a true relation between the sumti is something other than what the selbri specifies. Scalar negation is expressed by cmavo of selma'o NAhE:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: la .alis. cu na'e ke cadzu klama [ke'e] le zarci
interlinear-gloss.gloss: That-named Alice - non- ( walkingly goes-to ) the market.
interlinear-gloss.natlang: Alice doesn't walk to the market.

section.para: kefor expanding scope of scalar negation meaning that Alice's relationship to the market is something other than that of walking there. But if the ke were omitted, the result would be:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: la .alis. cu na'e cadzu klama le zarci
interlinear-gloss.gloss: That-named Alice - non- walkingly goes-to the market.
interlinear-gloss.natlang: Alice doesn't walk to the market.

section.para: meaning that Alice does go there in some way (klama is not negated), but by a means other than that of walking. negates both cadzu and klama, suggesting that Alice's relation to the market is something different from walkingly-going; it might be walking without going, or going without walking, or neither.
Of course, any of the simple selbri types explained in may be used in place of brivla in any of these examples:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: la djonz. cu na'e pamoi cusku
interlinear-gloss.gloss: That-named Jones - is-non- 1st speaker
interlinear-gloss.natlang: Jones is not the first speaker.

section.para: Since only pamoi is negated, an appropriate inference is that he is some other kind of speaker.

section.title: Tenses and bridi negation
section.para: A bridi can have cmavo associated with it which specify the time, place, or mode of action. For example, in

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi pu klama le zarci
interlinear-gloss.gloss: I [past] go-to the market.
interlinear-gloss.natlang: I went to the market.

section.para: the cmavo pu specifies that the action of the speaker going to the market takes place in the past. Tenses are explained in full detail in . Tense is semantically a property of the entire bridi; however, the usual syntax for tenses attaches them at the front of the selbri, as in . There are alternative ways of expressing tense information as well. Modals, which are explained in , behave in the same way as tenses.

Similarly, a bridi may have the particle na (of selma'o NA) attached to the beginning of the selbri to negate the bridi. A negated bridi expresses what is false without saying anything about what is true. Do not confuse this usage with the scalar negation of . For example:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: la djonz. na pamoi cusku
interlinear-gloss.gloss: That-named Jones (Not!) is-the-first speaker
interlinear-gloss.natlang: It is not true that Jones is the first speaker.
Jones isn't the first speaker.

section.para: bridi negationrelative order with tense tenserelative order with bridi negation Various combinations of tense and bridi negation cmavo are permitted. If both are expressed, either order is permissible with no change in meaning:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi na pu klama le zarci
interlinear-gloss.natlang: It is false that I went to the market.
I didn't go to the market.

section.para: bridi negationmultiple It is also possible to have more than one na, in which case pairs of na cmavo cancel out:

interlinear-gloss.jbo: mi na na klama le zarci
interlinear-gloss.natlang: It is false that it is false that I go to the market.
I go to the market.

section.para:
tense and namultiple na and tensemultiple It is even possible, though somewhat pointless, to have multiple na cmavo and tense cmavo mixed together, subject to the limitation that two adjacent tense cmavo will be understood as a compound tense, and must fit the grammar of tenses as explained in
.

interlinear-gloss.gloss: I [not] [past] [not] [present] go-to the market
interlinear-gloss.natlang: It is not the case that in the past it was not the case that in the present I went to the market.
I didn't not go to the market.
I went to the market.

section.para: negation cmavoposition relative to selbri modal cmavoposition relative to selbri tense cmavoposition relative to selbri Tense, modal, and negation cmavo can appear only at the beginning of the selbri. They cannot be embedded within it.

section.title: Some types of asymmetrical tanru
section.para: tanruasymmetrical asymmetrical tanru This section and contain some example tanru classified into groups based on the type of relationship between the modifying seltau and the modified tertau. All the examples are paralleled by compounds actually observed in various natural languages. In the tables which follow, each group is preceded by a brief explanation of the relationship. The tables themselves contain a tanru, a literal gloss, an indication of the languages which exhibit a compound analogous to this tanru, and (for those tanru with no English parallel) a translation.

languagesabbreviations for Here are the 3-letter abbreviations used for the various languages (it is presumed to be obvious whether a compound is found in English or not, so English is not explicitly noted):
Any lujvo or fu'ivla used in a group are glossed at the end of that group.

asymmetrical tanrudefinition The tanru discussed in this section are asymmetrical tanru; that is, ones in which the order of the terms is fundamental to the meaning of the tanru. For example,
junla dadysli, or clock pendulum, is the kind of pendulum used in a clock, whereas dadysli junla, or pendulum clock, is the kind of clock that employs a pendulum. Most tanru are asymmetrical in this sense. Symmetrical tanru are discussed in .
asymmetrical tanru typesobject-of-action + action The tertau represents an action, and the seltau then represents the object of that action:
asymmetrical tanru typeselements-in-set + set The tertau represents a set, and the seltau the type of the elements contained in that set:

asymmetrical tanru typesset + element-of-set Conversely: the tertau is an element, and the seltau represents a set in which that element is contained. Implicitly, the meaning of the tertau is restricted from its usual general meaning to the specific meaning appropriate for elements in the given set. Note the opposition between zdani lijgri in the previous group, and lijgri zdani in this one, which shows why this kind of tanru is called asymmetrical.

asymmetrical tanru typesobject + component/detail The seltau specifies an object and the tertau a component or detail of that object; the tanru as a whole refers to the detail, specifying that it is a detail of that whole and not some other.

asymmetrical tanru typescharacteristic/detail + object Conversely: the seltau specifies a characteristic or important detail of the object described by the tertau; objects described by the tanru as a whole are differentiated from other similar objects by this detail.
asymmetrical tanru typesgeneral-class + sub-class The tertau specifies a general class of object (a genus), and the seltau specifies a sub-class of that class (a species):

asymmetrical tanru typespossessor + object The tertau specifies an object of possession, and the seltau may specify the possessor (the possession may be intrinsic or otherwise). In English, these compounds have an explicit possessive element in them: lion's mane, child's foot, noble's cow.
asymmetrical tanru typesinhabitant + habitat The tertau specifies a habitat, and the seltau specifies the inhabitant:
asymmetrical tanru typeseffect + causative agent The tertau specifies a causative agent, and the seltau specifies the effect of that cause:
asymmetrical tanru typescause + effect Conversely: the tertau specifies an effect, and the seltau specifies its cause.
asymmetrical tanru typespurpose-of-instrument + instrument The tertau specifies an instrument, and the seltau specifies the purpose of that instrument:

asymmetrical tanru typesobject-of-purpose-of-instrument + instrument More vaguely: the tertau specifies an instrument, and the seltau specifies the object of the purpose for which that instrument is used:
asymmetrical tanru typessource + product The tertau specifies a product from some source, and the seltau specifies the source of the product:
asymmetrical tanru typesproduct + source Conversely: the tertau specifies the source of a product, and the seltau specifies the product:

asymmetrical tanru typessource-material + object The tertau specifies an object, and the seltau specifies the material from which the object is made. This case is especially interesting, because the referent of the tertau may normally be made from just one kind of material, which is then overridden in the tanru.
Note: the two senses of blaci kanla can be discriminated as:

asymmetrical tanru typesobject-measured + standard-object The tertau specifies a typical object used to measure a quantity and the seltau specifies something measured. The tanru as a whole refers to a given quantity of the thing being measured. English does not have compounds of this form, as a rule.

asymmetrical tanru typesoverriding-property + object-with-implicit-properties The tertau specifies an object with certain implicit properties, and the seltau overrides one of those implicit properties:

asymmetrical tanru typeswhole + part The seltau specifies a whole, and the tertau specifies a part which normally is associated with a different whole. The tanru then refers to a part of the seltau which stands in the same relationship to the whole seltau as the tertau stands to its typical whole.

asymmetrical tanru typesproduct + producer The tertau specifies the producer of a certain product, and the seltau specifies the product. In this way, the tanru as a whole distinguishes its referents from other referents of the tertau which do not produce the product.

asymmetrical tanru typesobject-giving-characteristic + other-object The tertau specifies an object, and the seltau specifies another object which has a characteristic property. The tanru as a whole refers to those referents of the tertau which possess the property.
asymmetrical tanru typessimilar-appearance-object + object As a particular case (when the property is that of resemblance): the seltau specifies an object which the referent of the tanru resembles.

td.para: fu'ivla for cherry based on Linnean name

section.para: asymmetrical tanru typestypical-place + object The seltau specifies a place, and the tertau an object characteristically located in or at that place.
asymmetrical tanru typesobject + place-sold Specifically: the tertau is a place where the seltau is sold or made available to the public.
asymmetrical tanru typeslocus-of-application + object The seltau specifies the locus of application of the tertau.
asymmetrical tanru typesactivity + implement-used The tertau specifies an implement used in the activity denoted by the seltau.
asymmetrical tanru typesundesired-object + protection-object The tertau specifies a protective device against the undesirable features of the referent of the seltau.
asymmetrical tanru typesobject + usual-container The tertau specifies a container characteristically used to hold the referent of the seltau.
asymmetrical tanru typescharacteristic-time + event The seltau specifies the characteristic time of the event specified by the tertau.
asymmetrical tanru typesenergy-source + powered The seltau specifies a source of energy for the referent of the tertau.
asymmetrical tanru typesmiscellaneous Finally, some tanru which don't fall into any of the above categories.

It is clear that tooth is being specified, and that milk and eye act as modifiers. However, the relationship between ladru and denci is something like tooth which one has when one is drinking milk from one's mother, a relationship certainly present nowhere except in this particular concept. As for kanla denci, the relationship is not only not present on the surface, it is hardly possible to formulate it at all.

section.title: Pretty little girls' school: forty ways to say it
section.para: pretty little girls' schoolforty ways The following examples show every possible grouping arrangement of melbi cmalu nixli ckule using bo or ke…ke'e for grouping and je or jebo for logical connection. Most of these are definitely not plausible interpretations of the English phrase pretty little girls' school, especially those which describe something which is both a girl and a school.

, , , , and are repeated here as , , , , and respectively. The seven examples following each of these share the same grouping pattern, but differ in the presence or absence of je at each possible site. Some of the examples have more than one Lojban version. In that case, they differ only in grouping mechanism, and are always equivalent in meaning.

The logical connective je is associative: that is, A and (B and C) is the same as (A and B) and C. Therefore, some of the examples have the same meaning as others. In particular, , , , , and all have the same meaning because all four brivla are logically connected and the grouping is simply irrelevant. Other equivalent forms are noted in the examples themselves. However, if
je were replaced by naja or jo or most of the other logical connectives, the meanings would become distinct.

It must be emphasized that, because of the ambiguity of all tanru, the English translations are by no means definitive – they represent only one possible interpretation of the corresponding Lojban sentence.
